fields.title: Laplace approximation
fields.pointers:
* Some other approximations to Bayesian parameter estimation include:
**  [variational Bayes](variational_bayes)
**  [Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC)](markov_chain_monte_carlo)
* The  [Bayesian information criterion (BIC)](bayesian_information_criterion)  can be  [justified](justifying_aic_and_bic)  in terms of the Laplace approximation.
* Some other ways to approximate the model evidence include:
**  [variational Bayes](variational_bayes)
**  [MCMC](mcmc_partition_function)
* The Laplace approximation approximates the posterior with a Gaussian. Other Gaussian approximations are more accurate, though often slower and more complicated to implement:
**  [expectation propagation](expectation_propagation)
**  [Gaussian lower bound to the logistic function](variational_logistic_regression)
fields.summary: The Laplace approximation is a way of approximating Bayesian parameter estimation and Bayesian model comparison. It is based on a second-order Taylor approximation of the log posterior around the MAP estimate, which results in a Gaussian approximation to the posterior.
